content: Miss Q.D, Kong, Prof. L-L, Liu, and Prof. Z.Y. Li  School of Environmental and Material Engineering   Yantai University  Yantai, 264005, China.
Miss Q.D, Kong, Prof. L-L, Liu, and Prof. Z.Y. Li  School of Environmental and Material Engineering  Yantai University  Yantai, 264005, China.

Synthesis of CHO -C4A: CHO -C4A was synthesized by the previous literature with a modified procedure.[24] Hexamethylene tetramine (6 g, 42.8 mmol) w as added into 40 mL trifluoroacetic acid with 25,26,27,28 -tetrahydroxycalix[4]arene (0.5 g, 1.2 mmol) to heated to reflux for 24  h. The resulting reactants were then cooled and stirred with hydrochloric acid (1.0 mol/L, 100 mL) and dichloromethane (75 mL) for 6 h. The organic layer was separated and washed with deionized water (50 mL) twice to get solvent evaporat ion under reduced pressure. Then a yellow solid was obtained after recrystallization with dichloromethane.  The yield of CHO -C4A was approximately 72% .

Synthesis of C4A -TAPA:  0.174 mmol of TAPA, 0.13 mmol of CHO -C4A, 0.5 mL of glacial acetic acid (6.0 mol/L), 1 mL of o -dichlorobenzene were added into a Pyrex tube. The tube was flash -frozen at 77 K ( in a liquid nitrogen bath), vacuumized, flame sealed , and heated at 100 ?C for 72 h resulting in the formation of  a reddish -brown  solid. The material was ground and washed several times with DMF and THF. Then it was dried at 80 ?C for 12 h.  The yield reached approximately 68%.  C4A-TAPA  is soluble in DMSO  and insoluble in other common  organic solvents , such as THF, DMF,  ethanol , methanol , acetone, acetonitrile, trichloromethane .

Synthesis o f C4A -TAPB : 0.149 mmol of TAPB, 0.111 mmol of CHO -C4A, 0.5 mL of glacial acetic acid (6.0 mol/L), 1 mL of o -dichlorobenzene were added into a Pyrex tube. The tube was flash -frozen at 77 K ( in a liquid nitrogen bath), vacuumized, flame sealed , and heated at 120 ?C for 96 h resulting in the formation of  a yellow solid. The material was ground and washed several times with DMF and THF. Then it was dried at 80 ?C for 12 h.  The yield was approximately 66%.  C4A-TAPB is soluble in DMSO  and insoluble in other common organic s olvents , such as THF, DMF,  ethanol , methanol , acetone , acetonitrile , trichloromethane .

The formation of the large cages is confirmed  through their r elative molecular mass  measure d using MALDI -TOF/TOF spectra . The protonated molecular ion peaks of C4A -TAPA and C4A -TAPB were observed at m/z 5109.0 ( calculated for C 336H240O24N32: m/z 5109.7 ) and m/z 5594.2 ( calculated for C 384H264O24N24: m/z 5598.4 ). C4A-POCs exhibit I -type N 2 adsorption -desorption isotherms with the BET surface areas of 144 4.9 m2?g-1 and 101 4.6 m2?g-1. The CO 2 uptakes at 273 K are 62.1 cm3?g-1 and 52.4 cm3?g-1 at a pressure of 100 KPa. The saturated iodine vapor static uptakes at 348 K are 3.9 g?g-1 and 3.5 g?g-1. The adsorption capacity of C4A -TAPA for SO 2 reaches to 124.4 cm3?g-1 at 298  K and 1.3 bar. Additionally, the adsorption capacities of C4A-TAPA for C2H2, C2H4, and C 2H6 were evaluated.

Gas adsorption analysis  The I -type N 2 adsorption -desorption isotherms[3a] of C4A -POC s are shown in Fig ure 3a and 3b, indicating their microporous nature. The Brunauer ?Emmett?Teller (BET) surface areas are 1444.9 m2?g-1 and 10 14.6 m2?g-1 for C4A -TAPA and C4A -TAPB, respectively. According to nonlocal density functional theory (NLDFT), they both exhibit uniform pore size distributions of approximately 1.1 nm (the inset in Fig ure 3a and 3b). The CO 2 uptakes of C4A -TAPA and C4A -TAPB at 195 K are 316 .3 cm3?g-1 and 171 .0 cm3?g-1 at a relative pressure (P/P 0) of 0.949  and (Figure 3c). Moreover, their CO 2 uptakes  at 273 K are 62.1 cm3?g-1 (C4A-TAPA ) and 52 .4 cm3?g-1 (C4A-TAPB) under 100 KPa  10.1002/chem.202400947Accepted ManuscriptChemistry - A European JournalThis article is protected by copyright. All rights reserved.

Moreover, C4A-POCs possess high BET specific surface areas of 1444.9 m2?g-1 and 101 4.6 m2?g-1, and demonstrate the adsorption capabilities towards various gases.  In particular , C4A-TAPA exhibits an advanced  adsorption capacit y for SO 2 (124.4 cm3?g-1) at 298 K and 1.3 bar , as well as a iodine vapor uptake  of 3.9 g?g-1.

The four-jaw C4A unit tends to  follow the face -directed self -assembly law with the planar triangular building blocks  such as  tris(4 -aminophenyl)amine (TAPA) or 1,3,5 -tris(4 -aminophenyl)benzene (TAPB)  to generate  a predictable  cage  with a stoichiometry of [6+8] .

15213765, ja, Downloaded from https://chemistry-europe.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/chem.202400947 by Zhejiang University, Wiley Online Library on [11/05/2024]. See the Terms and Conditions (https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/terms-and-conditions) on Wiley Online Library for rules of use; OA articles are governed by the applicable Creative Commons LicenseRESEARCH ARTICLE     2  with the stoichiometry of [6+8] when the conical C4A encounters highly rigid and directional triangular structural units.[8, 11] Herein, two POC s were constructed from a four -jaw bowl -shaped C4A and rigid triangular triamines as building blocks. As shown in Figure 1,  1-aldehyde -4-hydroxy -calix[4]arene (CHO -C4A), a conical calix[4]arene with four aldehyde groups on the upper -rim, and tris(4 -aminophenyl)amine (TAPA) or 1,3,5 -tris(4 -aminophenyl)benzene (TAPB), a rigid triangular triamine, were self-assembled though the Sc hiff base reaction to form stoichiometric [6+8] type organic cages (named C4A -TAPA and C4A-TAPB, collectively called C4A-POC s).

The configuration of the individual cage was predicted, based on the geometry and binding mode of the pre -designed building blocks. Generally, when conical C4A assembles with linear units, the resulting products exhibit diverse configurations including edge-directed cages such as [2+4] dimers, [3+6] triangular prisms, and [6+12] truncated octahedrons (Fig ure S1).[4e] Alternatively, they may form spatially extended two -dimensional layered structures.[12] However, if C4A assembles with planar triangular units , like TAPA or TAPB, it is highly probable that the truncated octahedral organic cages with a stoichiometry of [6+8] will be formed (Fig ure 1).

However, the acquisition of a single crystal sample presents a formidable challenge due to the substantial molecular weight of this molecular cage, which hinders the determination of accurate  crystal structure data.  At present, only two SC -XRD data of the similar large -sized POC s are reported by Yuan Daqiang¡®s group[11c]. Nevertheless, matrix -assisted laser desorption ionization time of flight  (MALDI -TOF/TOF) mass spectrometry can determine the relative molecular mass of the reaction product, which is usually employed  to verify the existence of the discrete cages.[14] The MALDI -TOF-MS spectra of C4A -POC s (Fig ure 2e) were collected by dissolving them in DMSO. The major ion signals of C4A -TAPA and C4A -TAPB are m/z 5109.0 and m/z 5594.2, which correspond to the theoretical relative molecular weight of [6+8] cage s (calc. C 336H240O24N32: m/z 5109.7 for C4A -TAPA and calc. C 384H264O24N24: m/z 5598.4 for C4A -TAPB). The transmission electron microscopy (TEM) images (Fig ure 2f) show that C4A -POC s are spherical particles , and C4A -TAPB is a uniform nanoparticle with a diameter of less than 100 nm.  The thermogravimetric  analysis (TGA) in Fig ure S2 shows that C4A -POC s do not substantially lose weight until the temperature rises to 400 ?C, demonstrating their high thermal stability.

Conclusion  In summary , we propose that when the four-jaw conical C4A units meet  the triangular structural blocks, they tend to t ake place  the face-directed self -assembly process , resulting in the formation of  octahedral  cages with the stoichiometry of [6+8] . This statement  indicates the highly structural predictability of C4A -POCs and supports  the design strategy for organic cages based on C4A -CHO and p lanar triamine s. We have successfully implemented this idea and synthesized two large -sized POCs , namely C4A -TAPA ( C336H240O24N32) and C4A -TAPB ( C384H264O24N24). The PXRD analysis reveal s the crystalline  characteristics  of the two C4A-POCs ; however , precise crystallographic data are unavailable due to the absence of a single crystal sample . The formation of the large cages is confirmed through their relative molecular mass measured using MALDI -TOF/TOF spectra.
